channel.title: Is 25MB of memory good for holding 100 players (Each thread = 256KB)?
channel.description:
Well, I have been observing some code in a Login Server, and I saw this:
[code=java] new Thread(new Player(client)).start(); [/code]
I saw in the comments that this is a thread which runs a new player with the arguments of the socket of the player. I also saw that this uses 256KB of memory for 1 player (meaning 25MB of memory for holding 100). Is this good?

item.title: Is 25MB of memory good for holding 100 players (Each thread = 256KB)?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

use benchmarking tools to figure out if it’s good or not. 500mb for 2k players i suppose isn’t bad considering a proper rs2 server would be pretty meaty (8GB RAM+).

Read full topic
item.source: Is 25MB of memory good for holding 100 players (Each thread = 256KB)?

item.title: Is 25MB of memory good for holding 100 players (Each thread = 256KB)?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m not too sure but there are definitely other factors which would change the actual final memory usage ;p but it sounds good from my nooby perspective.

Read full topic

item.title: Is 25MB of memory good for holding 100 players (Each thread = 256KB)?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

depends on a bit more. The server itself is more than just holding players- it also runs other stuff (npcs, events, etc) that will eat up some memory. Outside of this, I cannot give any knowledge in this area.

Read full topic
